TypeSignature.Value: .class interface public abstract IDictionary implements System.Collections.ICollection, System.Collections.IEnumerable

summary.para: Implemented by classes that support collections of associated keys and values (i.e. dictionaries).

block.para: Each key-value pair must have a unique non-null key, but the value of an association can be any object reference, including a null reference. The interface allows the contained keys and values to be enumerated, but it does not imply any particular sort order.

implementations fall into three categories: read-only, fixed-size, variable-size. A read-only implementation cannot be modified. A fixed-size implementation does not allow the addition or removal of elements, but it allows the modification of existing elements. A variable-size implementation allows the addition, removal and modification of elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual abstract void Add(object key, object value)
public void Add (object key, object value);

Docs.param: The to use as the key of the entry to add.
The to use as the value of the entry to add.

summary.para: Adds an entry with the provided key and value to the current instance.

remarks.para: If the specified key already exists in the current instance, this method throws a exception but does not modify the associated value.

exception.para: An entry with the same key already exists in the current instance.
The current instance is read-only or has a fixed size.

summary.para: Removes all key and value pairs from the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .property bool IsFixedSize { public hidebysig virtual abstract specialname bool get_IsFixedSize() }
public bool IsFixedSize { get; }

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the current instance has a fixed size.

para.block: A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements, but does allow the modification of existing elements.
The default of this property is .
Override this method, setting the value as , to prevent the addition and removal of the elements in the current instance.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the current instance is read-only.

value.para: if the current instance is read-only; otherwise, .

para.block: A collection that is read-only does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements.
The default of this property is .
Override this method, setting the value as , to prevent the addition, removal, and modification of the elements in the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .property object Item[object key] { public hidebysig virtual abstract specialname object get_Item(object key) public hidebysig virtual abstract specialname void set_Item(object key, object value) }
public object this[object key] { set; get; }

Docs.param: The key of the element to get or set.

summary.para: Gets or sets the element in the current instance that is associated with the specified key.

value.para: The element with the specified key.

para.block: This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: myCollection[index].

block.para: When setting this property, if the specified key already exists in the current instance, the value is required to be replaced; otherwise, a new element is required to be created.

exception.para: The property is set and the current instance is read-only.
The property is set, does not exist in the collection, and the current instance has a fixed size.

Docs.param: The key of the entry to remove.

summary.para: Removes the entry with the specified key from the current instance.

block.para: If is not found in the current instance, no exception is thrown and the current instance remains unchanged.

exception.para: The current instance is read-only or has a fixed size.
